meanings.definition: Not related by blood or marriage.
meanings.sent1: The two friends were nonrelative, but their bond was strong.
meanings.sent2: The nonrelative neighbors often helped each other with yard work.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the nonrelative siblings argue over who got the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The nonrelative connection between the two colleagues was like a hidden thread tying them together.
meanings.sent5: The nonrelative relationship between the cat and the dog was surprisingly harmonious.

meanings.definition: Not dependent on or influenced by something else.
meanings.sent1: Her decision was nonrelative to anyone else's opinion.
meanings.sent2: The artist's style was truly nonrelative to any current trends.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch the nonrelative plant grow in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent4: The nonrelative strength of her character shone through in times of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The nonrelative success of the small business was a testament to its unique approach.

meanings.sent1: The sizes of the objects were nonrelative to each other.
meanings.sent2: In this context, the colors are nonrelative to the overall design.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the nonrelative shapes fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The nonrelative positions of the planets created a mesmerizing pattern in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The nonrelative speeds of the cars made it hard to determine the winner.
